intro: Rubus ciliatus var. luebeckii, commonly known as the Lübeck raspberry, is a shrub native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red when ripe, containing multiple drupes. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and open areas. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
